lines.text: My question is about my Aunt Denise. She's not baptized, so that means she's going to Hell right?
Uh, no, actually she's not, Joshua.
And my dad's best friend, he's not baptized either, and that means *he's* going to hell.
[kids beginning to clammer nervously]
Joshua, I think you misunderstood.
Oh man! Seth Greenburg rides my bus, he's not baptized...
Okay, wait a sec...
Hey, my cousin's going to hell?
No, I don't think...
The family living next door - their whole house is going to hell!
No, that's not what it says in the book. If you'll notice, on page four... Ok alright, quiet! No one is going to Hell!

Before this year, bullies were just bullies for no reason, weirdos were just weird, and daredevils weren't afraid of anything. Before this year, people I loved lived forever. I spent this year looking for something and wound up seeing everything around me. It's like I was asleep before and finally woke up. Know what? I'm wide-awake now.
[last lines]
My name is Joshua A. Beal. I live in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. And I believe two things. Not all angels have wings. And sixth grade's got to be easier than this.
Hey Josh, is today tomorrow?
No Frank, tomorrow's tomorrow. Today's today, and tomorrow's tomorrow.
Joshua, why do you feel the need to do these things?

[waking him]
Joshua. Joshua. Joshua, *please*, you're a 5th grader today, you're almost a man.
Those are the kids in my class. Kids in uniforms don't smile very much.

[looking across into girl's play yard]
I don't know why they put this fence up. Why would anyone what to go over there, anyway?
Joshua, the pope is not God.
I know that, but he's his best friend.
We're not going to Rome.
Every day at sunset you'd bow your head to the east and pray, is that right?
Uh, I stopped that.
Okay, well what did you think about when you prayed?
Nothing mostly. Sometimes, I'd wonder... what made that smell in the carpet?
